revised_title: Transmission of Amakebe and East Coast Fever by Brown Ticks
tldr: The author investigates the transmission of Amakebe, a disease in calves, by the brown tick Rhipicephalus appendiculatus. They find that the disease is identical to East Coast fever and can be transmitted by these ticks, which act as hosts for the parasite Theileria parva. This study confirms the conclusion made by the Royal Society Sleeping Sickness Commission of 1909.
